page.title: 15Recreation; Upton Snodsbury
page.content: The permanent pasture land in the area makes it ideal hunting country. It is hunted regularly by The Croome & West Warwickshire Foxhounds. Lady Maria Coventry a joint master is a great grand daughter of The Earl of Coventry who founded the pack in 1874. Game shooting is popular in this district with its fine spinneys and coppices. Gardening is a popular recreation. Gardens are well cared for and many are opened from time to time for a garden 'walkabout'. The garden at Upton Snodsbury garage has a very fine and large ornamental fish pond. Several of the public houses have pleasant garden areas where customers may sit at tables in warm weather.
